member.name: T:NurApiDotNet.NurApi
member.summary:
The NurApiDotNet namespace contains classes for creating C# based applications for Nordic ID UHF RFID reader module family.
All products with module:
NUR-05W
NUR-05W L2
NUR-10W (1W module)
NUR2-1W (1W module)
NurApi class

member.summary: Filter action for extended inventory: Matching tags: negate SL or invert inventoried session flag (A->B, B->A). Non-matching: do nothing.

member.name: F:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.FACTION_4
member.summary: Filter action for extended inventory: Matching tags: deassert SL or inventoried session flag -> B. Non-matching: assert SL or inventoried session flag -> A.

member.summary: Filter action for extended inventory: Matching tags: deassert SL or inventoried session flag -> B. Non-matching: do nothing.

member.name: F:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.FACTION_6
member.summary: Filter action for extended inventory: Matching tags: do nothing. Non-matching: assert SL or inventoried session flag -> A.

member.name: F:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.FACTION_7
member.summary: Filter action for extended inventory: Matching tags: do nothing. Non-matching: negate SL or invert inventoried session flag (A->B, B->A).

member.name: M:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Standard constructor
member.param: Notfications will be executed in same thread where this Control is running

member.name: M:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.SetModuleSetup(System.Int32,NurApiDotNet.NurApi.ModuleSetup@)
member.summary: Set module settings according to given flags.
member.param: The setup fields to include presented as flag bits, see remarks.
member.exception: Thrown when "API not created" or "NurApiSetModuleSetup"
"Unsupported setup flags" is thrown when the native API DLL is detected not to support all the flags.
"Invalid setup.perAntPower field" SETUP_ANTPOWER is present but perAntPower field is invalid.
"Invalid setup.perAntOffset field" SETUP_POWEROFS is present but perAntOffset field is invalid.

remarks.para: See flags:
Set link frequency:
Set Set
Set TX level:
Set TX modulation: , modulations: ,
Set region:
Set default inventory Q:
Set default inventory session:
Set default inventory rounds/call:
Set antenna mask: , masks: ... ,
Set default single scan timeout in ms:
Set default inventory timeout in ms: , range is 0...60000 ms.
Set currently selected antenna: , 0...3 in basic setup and 0...17 in beam reader.
Set operation flags: , flags: and .
Set default inventory target: , targets: , and
Set fixed inventory EPC length: , range is 2...62 (must be aligned by 2) or -1 to accept all.
Set RSSI range for read operations: , RSSI filter: .
Set RSSI range for write operations: , RSSI filter: .
Set RSSI range for inventory: , RSSI filter: .
Set tag read timeout: , range: 20...1000 ms.
Set tag write timeout: , range: 20...2000 ms.
Set tag lock timeout: , range: 20...2000 ms.
Set tag kill timeout: , range: 20...2000 ms.
Set reader duty cycle in inventory stream: , values: 0 = off, 1 = max 100 ms off, 2 = max 500 ms off and 3 = max 100 off.
Set per antenna TX level (in 4 antenna reader): , entry having value -1 means "not used". Otherwise range as in TX level i.e. 0...19.
Set antenna TX level offset: , range is -1...1. E.g. TX level 10 with offset will become 11 (-1 i.e. less). Note that only first value is used, other are currently ignored.
Combination of all flags: .

member.name: M:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.Gen2v2ReadBuffer(System.Boolean,System.UInt32,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)

summary.para: Gen2 version 2 ReadBuffer command without tag selection.
This is similar to the regular read command but the read data source is the version 2 tag's internal buffer.

member.param: Set to true if the tag is accessed with password prior to the read command.
Password to use in case the tag's access is secured.
The bit address to start the reading from.
Number of bits to read from the buffer.
member.returns: Returns the structure containing the data and the actual bit length of the data.
member.exception: The operation can throw exception if the API is not created or and errror from the native API.

remarks.para: This method does not use tag singulation i.e. it is expected that only one tag is in the field.
Also note that the application is responsible for the bit data handling.
The bit level understanding is especially required in case where the returned data is not exactly byte (8-bit) aligned.

Bank where the selection mask is applied to.

member.returns: Returns the structure containing the data and the actual bit length of the data.
member.exception: The operation can throw exception if the API is not created or and errror from the native API.

This is similar to the regular read command but the read data source is the version 2 tag's internal buffer.

member.param: Set to true if the tag is accessed with password prior to the read command.
Password to use in case the tag's access is secured.
The bit address to start the reading from.
Number of bits to read from the buffer.
member.returns: Returns the structure containing the data and the actual bit length of the data.

The bit level understanding is especially required in case where the returned data is not exactly byte (8-bit) aligned.

member.name: M:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.Inventory
member.summary:
This function uses rounds, Q and session values from current module settings.
Actually copy of , included for historical reasons.
How it works:
The inventory operation returns information about the last inventory; it does not return tags. The inventory response contains namely the number of tags that were found during last inventory and the number of tags that are stored into the module's memory. After exeuting an inventory the tags need to be first retrieved from the module by calling or and after that the tags are available in the tag storage, that can be retrieved by the get tags storage command, see . If the inventory needs to be "clean" the method for clearing the module's is . Calling this method also clears the API's internal tag storage.
member.returns: Inventory result data as

member.name: M:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.InventoryEx
member.summary: Re-run the extended inventory assuming that the module has stored the parameters earlier.
member.returns: Inventory result data as
member.exception: Exception is thrown if API is not created othere was an error duting the native API call.
member.remarks:
The call will fail, if a prior call to extended inventory stream or single extended inventory has not been successful.
This means that the extended inventory can be re-run after the InventoryEx has been called once so that the extended parameters have been correct.
Effectively this results in less traffic between the host and the reader.

member.name: P:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.LinkFrequency
member.summary: Get / set tag backscatter link frequency in Hz.

remarks.para: Link frequency affects to frequency offset of tags replay in order to readers carrier wave. For example when used link frequency is 256 kHz, tag will replay at frequency of reader transmission frequency 256 kHz. Selectable parameters are 160 kHz, 256 kHz and 320 kHz. Tags that are compliant with ISO18000-6C (EPC C1G2) must support all these parameters. Link frequency also affects tag to reader data rate which is calculated by formula below:
Tag to reader data rate = (Link frequency / Miller coding)

value.para: By default link frequency is set 256 kHz. 256 kHz or 320 kHz settings must be used when operating in DRM mode.

member.name: P:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.RxDecoding
member.summary: Get/Set RX encoding (Miller encoding) value FM0 (0), M2 (1), M4 (2) or M8 (3)

remarks.para: Miller coding scheme affects tag to reader data rate. In practice miller coding affects the number of clock cycles that tag uses to modulate one symbol. So when using higher Miller coding scheme tag to reader data rate will be slower but at the same time it is more robust to interferences. Also tags response spectrum is more concentrated around the link frequency when using high miller scheme. This allows receiver to use narrower channel filters. Selectable values are 2,4 and 8. When operating on DRM mode values 4 or 8 should be used. By default Miller 4 is used.

member.name: P:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.TxLevel
member.summary: Get / set transmission level attenuation in 1dB steps.

value.para: Range is 0...19: there are 20 (0...19) steps so minimum output power value for 500mW devices is 8dBm (about 6mW) and 11dBm (about 40W) for the 1W devices.
This value is subtracted from the maxiumum TX level producing the actual level as follows:

remarks.para: Maximum output power is 27dBm (500mW) with NUR05W, NUR05WL and NUR05WL2 devices.
Maximum output power is 30dBm (1W) with NUR10W devices.
When using high output power it must be remembered that then antenna's SWR (Standing Wave Ratio) comes even more important.
Because high output power combined with antenna with poor SWR means that lot of power is reflected back to receiver.

member.name: P:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.TxModulation
member.summary: Get / set transmission modulation.
member.value: The TX modulation is either ASK () or PR-ASK ().

remarks.para: It is possible to use ASK (amplitude shift keying) or PR-ASK (phase reversed amplitude shift keying)modulation. Tags that are compliant with ISO18000-6C (EPC C1G2) must support both of these modulations. PR-ASK has lower transmission data rate and because of that it has narrower output spectrum. This is why it is recommended to be used when operating in DRM mode. By default the modulation is set to .

member.name: P:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.Region
member.summary: Get / set operating region.

item.country: Japan (maximum level = 250mW, mode = LBT, = 3 with 500mW device.)

remarks.para: Region setting changes reader to operate correctly for specified country of region.
It is very important that this setting is correct to meet local radio regulations.
The used antenna needs to be suitable for the selected operating region. For antenna tuning see .

member.name: P:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.InventoryQ
member.summary: Get / set default Q used for inventory. Value 0 - 15, where value 0 means automatic Q selection.

remarks.para:
Q-value defines the amount of open response slots that tags can use per one inventory round.
Number of slots can be calculated by this formula (s = number of "time slots"): s= Q^2 i.e. slots equal to Q to the power of 2.
It is advised to use twice as much slots compared to amount of tags that you have in your readers reading field simultaneously.
Selectable values are 0 15 and value 0 means automatic Q-value adjustment. When Q=0 is used reader will automatically increase the Q-value when lots of collisions are noticed and decreased the value when there are only few collisions. By default Q-value is set to 0.

member.name: P:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.InventorySession
member.summary: Get/Set default session for inventory. Value 0 - 3.
member.value: Default session for inventory. Value 0 - 3.

remarks.para: There are four session options what you can use when initializing inventory round. Every session has two target states A and B. By default gen2 tags are at state A if tag has not been read recently. When tag is read it flips to state B and doesnt replay to readers query. Table above describes persistence of tags state machine when using different session values. For example when using session 0 tag will come back to state A immediately when tag power is lost. Tag power is usually lost when reader stops the inventory round or chances the channel. With session 1 tag will keep it state over 500ms but less than 5s. With session values 2 and 3 tags will keep it states over 2s when tag power is lost. Time can vary depending what tag IC is used.
Table indicating persistence characteristics of gen2 tags.

member.name: P:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.InventoryRounds
member.summary: Get/Set default rounds for inventory. Value 0 - 10, where 0 means automatic rounds selection. This value specifies full G2 query rounds performed in one inventory command.
member.value: Range is from 0 to 10 where zero means "automatic rounds".
member.remarks: Rounds setting defines how many query rounds is done inside one inventory round. After every inventory round reader will send data to the Host. Selectable values are 0 10. Zero meaning automatic rounds adjustment. Automatic adjustment decides after every query round that is another round necessary based on amount of collisions. By default rounds setting is set to 0.

member.name: P:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.AntennaPower
member.summary:
Get / set per antenna power. Array with exactly 4 entries must be supplied.
DEPRECATED! For new designs, use AntennaPowerEx instead.

value.para: Each value corresponds to an antenna specific maximum power setting.
The maximum power is determined by subtracting the given value from either 27 (500mW module) or 30 (1W module).
When actually taken into use the range is 0...19, see also the .
If the value is -1 it means that the specific antenna does not use specific per antenna power limitation.
when the setting is -1 (not used) then the module's general TX level overrides this setting.
Array with exactly 4 entries must be supplied.

member.exception: May be thrown if the transport is not connected or with an invalid parameter value.

member.name: P:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.PowerOffset
member.summary: Get / set power offset.
member.value: The offset range is -1...1.

remarks.para: This value is used to "fine tune" the power value especially at the lower end of the TX level.
This value is added to the power level. When the value is negative then the level is set to lower one.
For example 17 will be 18 because the TX level is subtracted from the top value, see . A positive value will then increment the TX level.

member.summary: XPC removal control.

value.para: Set to true (default) to enable the XPC removing ahen a tag is retrieved from the storage.
Setting to false leaves the tag's EPC contents "as is".

remarks.para: If the XPC removal is set to true, then the API removes the possible XPC bytes from the beginning of the EPC data.
The removal is done when the tags are retrieved from the API's storage.
Also not that if the XPC is present and it is not removed then the tags' operations (read, write, lock, kill, etc.) that are based on the use of the EPC will fail.

member.name: T:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.NotificationCallbackDelegate
member.summary:
Used for receiving events from NurApi. NotificationCallbackDelegate is used to pass methods as arguments to other methods.
Event handlers are nothing more than methods that are invoked through delegates.
You create a custom method and a class such as a windows control can call your method when a certain event occurs. Any method from any accessible class or struct that matches the delegate's signature, which consists of the return type and parameters, can be assigned to the delegate. The method can be either static or an instance method. This makes it possible to programmatically change method calls, and also plug new code into existing classes. As long as you know the signature of the delegate, you can assign your own method.
In the NurApi contructor, , there is a simple pice of code that shows the connected and disconnected events' creation.

member.name: F:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.ModuleSetup.txLevel
member.summary:
Transmission (TX) power level in 1dB steps. See also the property)
Range is 0...19: there are 20 (0...19) steps so minimum output power value for 500mW devices is 8dBm (about 6mW) and 11dBm (about 40W) for the 1W devices.
This value is subtracted from the maxiumum TX level producing the actual level as follows: TX LevelPower dBm / mW (500 mW device)Power dBm / mW (1W device)
027 / 50030 / 1000
126 / 39829 / 794
225 / 31628 / 631
324 / 25127 / 501
423 / 20026 / 398
522 / 15825 / 316
621 / 12624 / 251
720 / 10023 / 200
819 / 7922 / 158
918 / 6321 / 126
1017 / 5020 / 100
1116 / 4019 / 79
1215 / 3218 / 63
1314 / 2517 / 50
1413 / 2016 / 40
1512 / 1615 / 32
1611 / 1314 / 25
1710 / 1013 / 20
189 / 812 / 16
198 / 611 / 13

member.summary: Session for inventory. Value 0 - 3.

member.summary: Total inventory time specified in milliseconds. Time is limited by maximum region channel time. Use 0 to disable.

member.summary: Inventory target, select whether tags whose inventoried flag is A or B participate in the inventory.

member.summary: Chooses which tags respond to the inventory.

member.name: T:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.InventoryExFilter
member.summary: Extended inventory function filter parameters. Represents G2 Select command, see UHF G2 standard section 6.3.2.11.1.1

member.name: F:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.InventoryExFilter.truncate
member.summary: Set to false always. NOT SUPPORTED AT THE MOMENT

member.name: F:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.InventoryExFilter.target
member.summary: Target session or SL. Indicates whether G2 select command modifies tag's SL flag or inventoried (A/B) flag.

member.name: F:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.InventoryExFilter.action
member.summary: Indicates whether matching tags assert or deassert SL, or set their inventoried flag to A or B.

remarks.para: The field action as per standard section 6.3.2.11.1.1 is defined as follows:

item.description: Matching tags: assert SL or inventoried session flag -> A. Non-matching: deassert SL or inventoried session flag -> B.
Matching tags: assert SL or inventoried session flag -> A. Non-matching: do nothing.
Matching tags: do nothing. Non-matching: deassert SL or inventoried session -> B.
Matching tags: negate SL or invert inventoried session flag (A->B, B->A). Non-matching: do nothing.
Matching tags: deassert SL or inventoried session flag -> B. Non-matching: assert SL or inventoried session flag -> A.
Matching tags: deassert SL or inventoried session flag -> B. Non-matching: do nothing.
Matching tags: do nothing. Non-matching: assert SL or inventoried session flag -> A.
Matching tags: do nothing. Non-matching: negate SL or invert inventoried session flag (A->B, B->A).

member.name: F:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.InventoryExFilter.bank
member.summary: Memory bank used for filter mask (1, 2 or 3). Bank must not be passwd bank.

member.summary: Filter mask data address in bits.

member.name: F:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.InventoryExFilter.maskData
member.summary: Mask data buffer.
member.remarks: Note that the data is left aligned.

member.summary: Status of WLan module. 0=disable 1=enable 2=disabled initializing when enabled.

member.name: F:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.WLanStatus.role
member.summary:
Current operation mode.
ROLE_STA = 0,ROLE_AP = 2,ROLE_P2P = 3
ROLE_STA_ERR = -1, Failure to load MAC/PHY in STA role
ROLE_AP_ERR = -ROLE_AP, Failure to load MAC/PHY in AP role
ROLE_P2P_ERR = -ROLE_P2P Failure to load MAC/PHY in P2P role

member.name: F:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.WLanStatus.wlan_connection_status
member.summary:
Current connection status
bit 0 = STATUS_BIT_CONNECTION the device is connected to the AP
bit 1 = STATUS_BIT_STA_CONNECTED client is connected to device
bit 2 = STATUS_BIT_IP_ACQUIRED the device has acquired an IP
bit 3 = STATUS_BIT_IP_LEASED the device has leased an IP
bit 4 = STATUS_BIT_CONNECTION_FAILED failed to connect to device

member.name: M:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.Tag.ReadPermalock(System.UInt32,System.Boolean,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Read block permalock statuses from this tag.
member.param: If true then access is done with the password
This is the first address of the first of 16-block chunk to read (0 -> 0, 1 -> 16, ...).
member.returns: Return an array of ushort (unsigned 16-bit) values representing the lock bits.

remarks.para: Each return word represents 16 block lock states i.e. on bit corresponds to a block.
The bit 0 represent block at address, bit 1 at address +1 and so on.

member.exception: If API is not created or native operation fails.

member.name: M:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.Tag.BlockPermalock(System.UInt32,System.Boolean,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt16[])
member.summary: Do BlockPermalock with this tag.
member.param: If true then access is done with the password
This is the first address of the first of 16-block chunk to apply the mask to (0 -> 0, 1 -> 16, ...).
Number of 16-block chunks to apply the mask to.
Each word represents on 16-block chunks lock mask as specified by Gen2 specification 1.2.0.
member.exception: If API is not created or native operation fails.

member.name: M:NurApiDotNet.NurApi.Tag.Gen2v2ReadBuffer(System.Boolean,System.UInt32,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)

summary.para: Gen2 version 2 ReadBuffer command with the tag being selected by its EPC contents.
This is similar to the regular read command but the read data source is the version 2 tag's internal buffer.

member.param: Set to true if the tag is accessed with password prior to the read command.
Password to use in case the tag's access is secured.
The bit address to start the reading from.
Number of bits to read from the buffer.
member.returns: Returns the structure containing the data and the actual bit length of the data.
member.exception: The operation can throw exception if the API is not created or and errror from the native API.

remarks.para: Note that the application is responsible for the bit data handling.
The bit level understanding is especially required in case where the returned data is not exactly byte (8-bit) aligned.
